intro: Hippocratea cumingii, commonly known as the Cuming's hippocratea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with palmate leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
